TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi sealed beforefieldinit FontStretch extends System.ValueType implements class System.IFormattable

Docs.summary: Describes the degree to which a font has been stretched compared to the normal aspect ratio of that font.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A font stretch describes the degree to which a font form is stretched from its normal aspect ratio, which is the original width to height ratio specified for the glyphs in the font. The values correspond to the `usWidthClass` definition in the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_opentype](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] specification. The `usWidthClass` represents an integer value between 1 and 9—lower values indicate narrower widths; higher values indicate wider widths. |Font stretch|usWidthClass|% of normal| |------------------|------------------|-----------------| ||1|50.0%| ||2|62.5%| ||3|75.0%| ||4|87.5%| ||5|100.0%| ||6|112.5%| ||7|125.0%| ||8|150.0%| ||9|200.0%| For more information on the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_opentype](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-opentype-md.md)] `usWidthClass` value, see the ["Font File Tables"](http://www.microsoft.com/typography/otspec/otff.htm) section of the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_opentype](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] specification. ## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Values *fontStretchesValue* A value expressed as the name string, such as "Condensed", "Normal", or "Expanded".

MemberSignature.Value: public static int Compare (System.Windows.FontStretch left, System.Windows.FontStretch right);
.method public static hidebysig int32 Compare(valuetype System.Windows.FontStretch left, valuetype System.Windows.FontStretch right) cil managed

Docs.returns: An <xref:System.Int32> value that represents the relationship between the two instances of .

remarks.format: ## Remarks When the return value is less than zero, `left` is less than `right`. When this value is zero, it indicates that both operands are equal. When the value is greater than zero, it indicates that `left` is greater than `right`.
